installation_guide.title: Complete MIB2 Toolbox Installation Guide
installation_guide.critical_warning: CRITICAL WARNING: This guide modifies the MIB2 system. ALWAYS make backups BEFORE proceeding. The user is responsible for any damage.
installation_guide.req_adapter: USB Ethernet adapter (ASIX spoofed or D-Link DUB-E100)
installation_guide.req_sd_card: SD card with at least 8 GB of free space
installation_guide.req_android: Android device with MIB2 Controller app
installation_guide.req_battery: Car battery charged or engine running
installation_guide.verify_connection_desc: Should respond with ping times. If no response, check Ethernet cable and adapter.
installation_guide.verify_root_desc: Should respond 'root'. If not, the connection is not valid.
installation_guide.backup_critical: NEVER skip this phase. Without backup, you CANNOT recover the system if something goes wrong.
installation_guide.backup_critical_desc: This is the MOST IMPORTANT file. Without this backup, you cannot revert the patch changes.
installation_guide.backup_full_time: This will take 10-30 minutes depending on system size. DO NOT interrupt the process.
installation_guide.copy_toolbox_desc: Copy Toolbox files (install.sh, bootstrap/, apps/) to /mnt/sd/ using an SD card reader on your PC.
installation_guide.run_installer_desc: The installer will ask for confirmation. Answer 'y' when prompted.
installation_guide.patch_warning: This step modifies the system binary. Make sure you have the backup from step 6.
installation_guide.reboot_desc: The system will take 2-3 minutes to reboot. Wait for the MIB2 screen to turn back on.
installation_guide.installation_complete: Installation completed successfully! Toolbox is ready to use.
installation_guide.restore_when: You only need to restore if something went wrong during installation or if the system doesn't boot properly.
installation_guide.restore_guided_desc: The guided_restore.sh script performs a full restoration with automatic integrity verification:
installation_guide.restore_guided_features: The script verifies MD5, available space and asks for confirmation before restoring. It's the SAFEST way to restore.
installation_guide.solution_check_cable: Check that the Ethernet cable is properly connected
installation_guide.solution_restart_mib2: Restart the MIB2 (hold the power button for 10 seconds)
installation_guide.solution_check_sd_format: Verify that the SD is formatted as FAT32 or QNX6
installation_guide.solution_restore_binary: Restore the critical binary from backup (Step 6 of Phase 2)
installation_guide.solution_check_space: Verify there's enough space on the system
installation_guide.solution_check_permissions: Verify you have root permissions (whoami should respond 'root')
installation_guide.problem_system_broken: Problem: System doesn't boot after installation
installation_guide.solution_use_guided_restore: Use the guided restoration script with the full backup from Step 8. This will restore the system to its original state.
installation_guide.resource_scripts: 'Commands' screen: Predefined scripts for each step
installation_guide.final_tip: Final tip: Save this guide and backups in a safe place. You never know when you'll need them.
